chapter_title: LAW 7 - GET OTHERS TO DO THE WORK FOR YOU, BUT ALWAYS TAKE THE CREDIT
summary: This chapter emphasizes the importance of leveraging the efforts of others to advance one’s own cause. By utilizing the skills and hard work of others, a person can appear more efficient and powerful. Historical examples, such as Nikola Tesla and Thomas Edison, illustrate how the true geniuses often remain unrecognized while others profit from their efforts. The narrative warns against the pitfalls of working alone and encourages individuals to be strategic in claiming credit for accomplishments. Ultimately, effective power dynamics involve sharing credit wisely while ensuring one’s own contributions are recognized.

slides.section_body: Harness the wisdom and abilities of others to achieve your own goals. By allowing others to do the work, you not only save resources but also enhance your own reputation for effectiveness. This strategic delegation fosters a powerful image of productivity.
slides.quote: Never do yourself what others can do for you.

slides.section_body: Nikola Tesla's brilliance was overshadowed by those who used his inventions for their gain. The struggles he faced reflect the harsh realities of innovation and credit. Many contributed to his discoveries yet few recognized his pivotal role.
slides.quote: Tesla was the real 'father of radio,' yet his name was lost.

slides.section_body: The tortoise's cleverness showcases the power of strategic thinking. By getting stronger animals to do the work for him, he emerges victorious. This illustrates the essence of the law: let others grind while you take center stage.
slides.quote: The tortoise let others do the work for him while he got the credit.

slides.section_body: While Tesla toiled endlessly, Edison adeptly marketed and took credit for innovations. This contrast highlights that being perceived as powerful sometimes surpasses actual invention. Edison’s strategy underscores the importance of public perception.
slides.quote: Edison’s main method was to hire the best to do the work for him.

slides.section_body: Securing recognition for an invention is crucial. Protect your ideas and ensure you receive the credit they merit. Being proactive about your contributions establishes your power and repels opportunistic rivals.
slides.quote: The credit for creation is as important as the creation itself.

slides.section_body: Rather than lamenting the loss of credit, learn to navigate the game of power. Observe the vultures circling above; they thrive by tapping into the work of others. Embrace this reality and position yourself advantageously.
slides.quote: Instead of fighting, join the game.

slides.section_body: Use the wisdom of history to your advantage. Stand upon the shoulders of giants, reaping the benefits of their knowledge. This approach allows you to appear innovative while securing your legacy.
slides.quote: Fools say they learn by experience; smart people profit from the experience of others.

slides.section_body: Trying to accomplish everything alone leads to burnout and inefficiency. Recognize the value in collaboration, as it conserves your energy for strategic endeavors. Progress efficiently by utilizing the talents at your disposal.
slides.quote: Conserve your forces and leverage others’ work.

slides.section_body: Acquire knowledge from everyone around you. By doing so, you enhance your reputation as a knowledgeable figure. This strategy reinforces your position while relying on the diligence of others.
slides.quote: By the sweat of another’s brow, you win the reputation of being an oracle.

slides.section_body: Sometimes, sharing credit can solidify your position. Avoid pushing others away; instead, acknowledge their contributions to maintain alliances. Flexibility in sharing the spotlight is essential for long-term success.
slides.quote: Know when to let others share the credit for mutual benefit.
